trans-unit.source: Mount, initialize, and format a volume
trans-unit.target: Mount, initialize, and format a volume

trans-unit.source: Explains how to configure a volume on a StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to configure a volume on a StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: To mount, initialize, and format a volume
trans-unit.target: To mount, initialize, and format a volume

trans-unit.source: Start the Microsoft iSCSI initiator.
trans-unit.target: Start the Microsoft iSCSI initiator.

trans-unit.source: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, on the **Discovery** tab, click **Discover Portal**.
trans-unit.target: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, on the **Discovery** tab, click **Discover Portal**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Discover Target Portal** dialog box, supply the IP address of your iSCSI-enabled network interface, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Discover Target Portal** dialog box, supply the IP address of your iSCSI-enabled network interface, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, on the **Targets** tab, locate the **Discovered targets**.
trans-unit.target: In the **iSCSI Initiator Properties** window, on the **Targets** tab, locate the **Discovered targets**.

trans-unit.source: The device status should appear as **Inactive**.
trans-unit.target: The device status should appear as **Inactive**.

trans-unit.source: Select the target device and then click **Connect**.
trans-unit.target: Select the target device and then click **Connect**.

trans-unit.source: After the device is connected, the status should change to **Connected**.
trans-unit.target: After the device is connected, the status should change to **Connected**.

trans-unit.source: (For more information about using the Microsoft iSCSI initiator, see [Installing and Configuring Microsoft iSCSI Initiator][1]).
trans-unit.target: (For more information about using the Microsoft iSCSI initiator, see [Installing and Configuring Microsoft iSCSI Initiator][1]).

trans-unit.source: On your Windows host, press the Windows Logo key + X, and then click **Run**.
trans-unit.target: On your Windows host, press the Windows Logo key + X, and then click **Run**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Run** dialog box, type **Diskmgmt.msc**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Run** dialog box, type **Diskmgmt.msc**.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**, and the **Disk Management** dialog box will appear.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**, and the **Disk Management** dialog box will appear.

trans-unit.source: The right pane will show the volumes on your host.
trans-unit.target: The right pane will show the volumes on your host.

trans-unit.source: In the **Disk Management** window, the mounted volumes will appear as shown in the following illustration.
trans-unit.target: In the **Disk Management** window, the mounted volumes will appear as shown in the following illustration.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the discovered volume (click the disk name), and then click **Online**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the discovered volume (click the disk name), and then click **Online**.

trans-unit.source: Initialize format volume
trans-unit.target: Initialize format volume

trans-unit.source: Right-click the volume (click the disk name) again, and then click **Initialize**.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the volume (click the disk name) again, and then click **Initialize**.

trans-unit.source: To format a simple volume, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To format a simple volume, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Select the volume, right-click it (click the right area), and click **New Simple Volume**.
trans-unit.target: Select the volume, right-click it (click the right area), and click **New Simple Volume**.

trans-unit.source: In the New Simple Volume wizard, specify the volume size and drive letter and configure the volume as an NTFS file system.
trans-unit.target: In the New Simple Volume wizard, specify the volume size and drive letter and configure the volume as an NTFS file system.

trans-unit.source: Specify a 64 KB allocation unit size.
trans-unit.target: Specify a 64 KB allocation unit size.

trans-unit.source: This allocation unit size works well with the deduplication algorithms used in the StorSimple solution.
trans-unit.target: This allocation unit size works well with the deduplication algorithms used in the StorSimple solution.

trans-unit.source: Perform a quick format.
trans-unit.target: Perform a quick format.
